name: Independence Arch
description: A monumental arch in Accra, Ghana, serving as a symbol of Ghana's independence from British colonial rule. It is part of the Independence Square complex.

name: Kwame Nkrumah Mausoleum
description: The final resting place of Ghana's first President, Osagyefo Dr. Kwame Nkrumah. It's a significant historical site with a museum dedicated to his life.

name: Makola Market
description: Accra's busiest and largest open-air market, offering a vibrant sensory experience with everything from fresh produce to textiles and crafts.

name: Labadi Pleasure Beach
description: One of Accra's most popular beaches, known for its lively atmosphere, local food stalls, cultural performances, and horse riding.

name: Jamestown Lighthouse
description: A historic lighthouse in the Jamestown area, offering panoramic views of Accra's coastline and the bustling fishing community below.

name: W.E.B. Du Bois Memorial Centre
description: Dedicated to the life and work of the prominent African-American civil rights activist and Pan-Africanist, W.E.B. Du Bois, who spent his final years in Ghana.

name: Osu Castle (Christianborg)
description: A historic castle built by the Danes, serving as a government seat for centuries. It played a significant role in the transatlantic slave trade.

name: Ghana National Museum
description: The largest and oldest of the museums under the administration of the Ghana Museums and Monuments Board, showcasing Ghana's rich history, culture, and art.
